comments.body: This is a GUI and I am not sure how to test it.

I know, we will have may be in 1.3 a basic example setup having test data for the standalone server. Then the standalone server could be used by the gui too and also tests can become based on this test data.

comments.body: A fix is under way and we will be able to remove `icu` from here soon. For more information see https://github.com/conda-forge/matplotlib-feedstock/issues/36
I have tom. some time to verify that yaml on my test setup. If it works I do a 1.2.1 release afterwards.

@ocefpaf 
I want to commit your yaml changes, like this:
"more relaxed version of meta.yaml, thx to ocefpaf (conda-forge-member)"
ok?

> I want to commit your yaml changes, like this:

That is fine, but the commit messages on staged-recipes are not "important" b/c once merged this recipe will be moved to its own repository (feedstock). Do you want to add that as comment somewhere? Or are you OK merging this as is and adding that comment as an issue so you can keep track of possible problems in the future (and change the specified versions)?

For now I want to add the modified yaml to our mss repository. (I modify it that it could work with defaults too for now)  Build then by that a new 1.2.1 release.  Then add it with little changes to conda-forge again. Then both pathes to install it are available and everyone should be satisfied.

A lot of the tools here makes it much easier to have faster builds. All that testing makes it much easier for us.

> For now I want to add the modified yaml to our mss repository.

Sure. So a comment here would help your users to distinguish them, right? I will do it like:

`# Relaxed versions of the run dependencies for conda-forge.`

Is that OK?

> (I modify it that it could work with defaults too for now

That is not an easy task! The maintainability will be hard. But I understand the reasons.

> A lot of the tools here makes it much easier to have faster builds. All that testing makes it much easier for us.

Glad to hear tit :smile:

Now 1.2.0 has everything pinned and 1.2.1 only basemap. I tested it with defaults on linux an windows.

https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/commits/0af86d26a4e0584dc596e1380f65cb8c0b5feaf0#chg-meta.yaml

The new checksum ;)

```

{% set version = "1.2.1" %}

package:
  name: mss
  version: {{ version }}

source:
    fn: mss-{{ version }}.tar.gz
    url: https://bitbucket.org/wxmetvis/mss/get/{{ version }}.tar.gz
    sha256: c08e72950a1150fd2a119a7fe766f966fe5a8b73c55fa02763c7a1e5a288f915

```
